The answer to many #HybridWork FAQs is simply clear communication.  says, "Clear is Kind," and that couldn't be more true in a hybrid setting: you can only build trust when you set clear expectations. Have you adjusted your communication for the new world of work?

A6 Wherever I work from, I make sure to:*Plan my week on Sunday and each day the night before*Know my priorities for the day*Break things down into smaller bites*Focus on being intentional with how I work*Have a stopping point each night#WinnieSun #wfh #WorkFromHome

A3b And let's be real that #workfromhome generally allowed you to have more balance. It is still important to define and maintain boundaries because it's really early to hop back on for 1 more email that turns into hours bec there is no leaving the office to head home.#winniesun

A2b Sorry, meetings won't go away, but they'll be more maximized. I think you'll see more companies and company leaders recognize that their strategies for when and how to do meetings must change. #winniesun #WFH #WorkFromHome

A2a I do think #WFH is (thankfully) here to stay. In the future we'll see companies embrace a more complete definition of #flexibleworking where people can work where, how, and when they choose for bigger chunks of time. #winniesun #WorkFromHome

A2 One of the benefits of the pandemic is that it compressed the timeline for companies embracing #WorkFromHome scenarios. For 2+ years employees and teams have shown they can get stuff done while working from home. #winniesun
